revised_title: Thermal Conductivities of Carbon Monoxide and Nitrous Oxide: Experimental Determinations and Implications
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to determine the thermal conductivities of carbon monoxide and nitrous oxide. They found that carbon monoxide has a thermal conductivity of 0.00005633 and nitrous oxide has a thermal conductivity of 0.00003740. These findings are important for understanding the properties of gases and their applications in various fields.
